headline.main: The Bodyguard; By Adrian Mitchell. 188 pp. New York: Doubleday & Co. $5.95.

results.snippet: Adrian Mitchell adds himself to a growing list of writers who are cautious prophets foretelling the near future. "The Bodyguard," set in the Britain of Orwell's "1984," purports to be the ramblings of the title character -- a secular age's most...
results.lead_paragraph: Adrian Mitchell adds himself to a growing list of writers who are cautious prophets foretelling the near future. "The Bodyguard," set in the Britain of Orwell's "1984," purports to be the ramblings of the title character -- a secular age's most ardent disciple -- though that announcement is the author's washing of the hands, leaving us to decide the fate of the book's botched prose.

headline.main: SHEPARD BIDS U.N. BACK ASTRONAUT AID

results.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 9 -- Adm. Alan B. Shepard, speaking for a "small band" of explorers in outer space, called today for quick approval by governments of a United Nations treaty on rescue and aid to astronauts.

headline.main: Connally Visits Sato at His Home

headline.main: F ranz Kafk'' The Complete Stores; Edited by Nahum N. Glatzer. 486 pp. New ork. Schocken Books. $12.50.

results.snippet: My uncle Zev from Prague, who wanted to be a poet, kept a journal of metaphysical speculations, fleeting apprehensions and the remarks of his friend Kafka, a dark, sickly, skinny lawyer with a Byzantine bird-face. Around the time that my uncle came...
results.lead_paragraph: My uncle Zev from Prague, who wanted to be a poet, kept a journal of metaphysical speculations, fleeting apprehensions and the remarks of his friend Kafka, a dark, sickly, skinny lawyer with a Byzantine bird-face. Around the time that my uncle came to America, abandoned poetry and hid his journal, Kafka became Franz Kafka of "The Trial," "The Castle," stories, diaries, letters and, in short, the most portentous, maybe greatest, writer of our century.

results.abstract: Levitts mark their 2d wedding anniv; couple illus

headline.main: A Night of Nostalgia Combined an Anniversary With a Benefit

results.snippet: WASHINGTON -- There is more than one way to celebrate Thanksgiving. The favorite method, of course, is to sit down to the traditional family dinner of turkey and trimmings, but for those who are more serious about getting to the roots of this country...
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- There is more than one way to celebrate Thanksgiving. The favorite method, of course, is to sit down to the traditional family dinner of turkey and trimmings, but for those who are more serious about getting to the roots of this country during the holiday weekend, or who want a stimulating change, a visit to the Smithsonian Institution's Museum of History and Technology can be a feast, too.

results.abstract: Gillian Cummings, upset at father's sudden death, keeps him preserved above ground sheathed in plastic and frozen in liquid nitrogen; has joined cryonics movement, devoted to hope that future scientists will discover how to restore life; Brookhaven Town officials recently refused permission for Cryo-Crypt Corp to open capsule storage room under century-old church

headline.main: After-Death Freezing Stirs Town on L.I.

results.snippet: MIDDLE ISLAND, L. I. -- Gillian Cummings was so upset at her father's sudden death last year and revolted at the thought of burial that she kept him preserved above ground, sheathed in plastic wrap and frozen in liquid nitrogen.
results.lead_paragraph: MIDDLE ISLAND, L. I. -- Gillian Cummings was so upset at her father's sudden death last year and revolted at the thought of burial that she kept him preserved above ground, sheathed in plastic wrap and frozen in liquid nitrogen.
